discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Blind/Inferential SQL Injection
Boolean-based blind SQL injection (sometimes called inferential SQL Injection) is performed by asking the right questions to the application database.Multiple valid statements evaluated as true or false are supplied in the affected parameter in the HTTP request. (P.2044/2028)

D correct.
Blind SQL (Structured Query Language) injection is a type of SQL Injection attack that asks the database true or false questions and determines the answer based on the applications response.
D correct

questions.question_text:
This type of injection attack does not show any error message. It is difficult to exploit as it returns information when the application is given SQL payloads that elicit a true or false response from the server. By observing the response, an attacker can extract sensitive information.
What type of attack is this?

discussion.content:
The answer is D. Power/clock/reset glitching

Optical, Electromagnetic Fault Injection (EMFI):
The main objective of these attacks is to inject faults into devices by PROJECTING LASERS and electromagnetic pulses that are used in analog blocks.

Power/Clock/Reset Glitching:
These types of attacks occur when faults or glitches are INJECTED into the Power supply that can be used for remote execution. 

The Answer is IN the Question.

Power/Clock/Reset Glitching
These types of attacks occur when faults or glitches are injected into the power supply that can be used for remote execution, also causing the skipping of key instructions. Faults can also be injected into the clock network used for delivering a synchronized signal across the chip.

Selected Answer: D
Fault Injection Attacks - Power/Clock/Reset Glitching
These types of attacks occur when faults or glitches are injected into the power supply that can be used for remote execution, also causing the skipping of key instructions. Faults can also be injected into the clock network used for delivering a synchronized signal across the chip. (P.2609/2593)

Selected Answer: D
Optical, Electromagnetic Fault Injection (EMFI) 
The main objective of these attacks is to inject faults into devices by projecting lasers and electromagnetic pulses that are used in analog blocks such as random number generators (RNGs) and for applying high-voltage pulses. These faults are then used by the attackers in compromising the system security

Power/Clock/Reset Glitching
These types of attacks occur when faults or glitches are injected into the power supply that can be used for remote execution, also causing the skipping of key instructions. Faults can also be injected into the clock network used for delivering a synchronized signal across the chip.

Selected Answer: D

questions.question_text:
Robert, a professional hacker, is attempting to execute a fault injection attack on a target IoT device. In this process, he injects faults into the power supply that can be used for remote execution, also causing the skipping of key instructions. He also injects faults into the clock network used for delivering a synchronized signal across the chip.
Which of the following types of fault injection attack is performed by Robert in the above scenario?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Web of Trust (WOT)
Web of trust (WoT) is a trust model of PGP, OpenPGP, and GnuPG accessible systems.In WoT, everyone in the network is a CA, and they can sign for other trusted entities.WoT is a network chain in which individuals intermediately validate each other’s certificates using their signatures. Every user in the network has a ring of public keys to encrypt the data, and they introduce many other users whom they trust. (P.3096/3080)
D is correct:CEHv11 page 3096 ring of public keys

D correct

There are two keys pertaining to a person: a public key which is shared openly and a private key that is withheld by the owner. The owner's private key will decrypt any information encrypted with its public key. In the web of trust, each user has a ring with a group of people's public keys. Users encrypt their information with the recipient's public key, and only the recipient's private key will decrypt it. Each user then digitally signs the information with their private key, so when the recipient verifies it against the user's own public key, they can confirm that it is the user in question.
Correct D

questions.question_text:
Jane is working as a security professional at CyberSol Inc. She was tasked with ensuring the authentication and integrity of messages being transmitted in the corporate network. To encrypt the messages, she implemented a security model in which every user in the network maintains a ring of public keys. In this model, a user needs to encrypt a message using the receiver's public key, and only the receiver can decrypt the message using their private key.
What is the security model implemented by Jane to secure corporate messages?

choices.B: Using wget to perform banner grabbing on the webserver
choices.C: Flooding the web server with requests to perform a DoS attack
choices.D: Downloading all the contents of the web page locally for further examination
choices.A: Performing content enumeration on the web server to discover hidden folders

questions.question_text: What would be the purpose of running "wget 192.168.0.15 -q -S" against a web server?

discussion.content:
-q, --quiet quiet (no output)
-S, --server-response print server response
This was on the exam 21.02.23

Selected Answer: A
The "wget" command is a utility used for downloading files from the web. When running "wget 192.168.0.15 -q -S" against a web server, it would attempt to download the default web page from that server and display some information about the download process.

The "-q" option specifies that wget should run in quiet mode, which means that it will not output any unnecessary information to the console during the download process. The "-S" option, on the other hand, tells wget to display the server's response headers, which can provide some additional information about the server's configuration.

In summary, the purpose of running "wget 192.168.0.15 -q -S" against a web server is to download the default web page from that server and display some additional information about the server's configuration.
Who will use this old tech to grab banner while haveing devtools in browser?!

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
This is definitely banner grabbing! https://securitytrails.com/blog/banner-grabbing#content-wget
We will be using the wget command to capture the HTTP banner of the remote server. for eg. wget –q –S 192.168.0.11

Selected Answer: B
Correct answer is B.
Check the forum about banner grabbing: https://www.hackingarticles.in/multiple-ways-to-banner-grabbing/

Selected Answer: B
the correct answer is B; it states on multiple sites that it is banner grabbing

questions.question_text:
Mike, a security engineer, was recently hired by BigFox Ltd. The company recently experienced disastrous DoS attacks. The management had instructed Mike to build defensive strategies for the company's IT infrastructure to thwart DoS/DDoS attacks. Mike deployed some countermeasures to handle jamming and scrambling attacks.
What is the countermeasure Mike applied to defend against jamming and scrambling attacks?

discussion.content:
wow. Cognitive Radio and DDoS. who would have known? a 1x line reference in the CEH v11 with no explanation.

I guess with this type of question endemic in the IT certification game generally the Exam Topics people will be in business for a looong time :)

you can read about it here...if you have subscription
https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/5567385

correct
Implement cognitive radios in the physical layer to handle jamming and scrambling attacks

It's D: CEHv12 p.1493: Additional DoS / DDos countermeasures: "PREVENT transmission of all types of addressed packes at the ISP level, ENABLE TCP SYN cookie protections, PREVENT usage of functions such as gets and strcpy, Implement cognitive radios in the physical level"
ISP --> A

Selected Answer: D
The correct option is D.
Implement cognitive radios in the physical layer
Should be there an information about how the attack has been took place?!

Selected Answer: D
Implement cognitive radios in the physical layer

Selected Answer: D
Additional DoS/DDoS Countermeasures
7. Implement cognitive radios in the physical layer to handle jamming and scrambling attacks. (P.1373)

Selected Answer: D
CEH book page 1373
Implement cognitive radios in the physical layer to handle jamming and scrambling attacks

In my university (Lancaster Uni) we learnt about this. Cognitive Radios basically means Smart radios. That is they are able to sense channels/frequencies (in the air) that have vacant/available/unused/white space, and from this unused space the radios/frequencies place themselves for transmission. Why do they need to sense? This is because there may be a channel/frequency that is allocated to premium user/subscribers. Cognitive radios aims to reduce the inefficiency and lack of utilization of free/unused spaces in the channel for free users/subscribers (because no premium user/subscriber will be using the channel all the time, and also frequency band are limited)

Selected Answer: D
In my opinion is D)

Selected Answer: A
correct
Implement cognitive radios in the physical layer to handle jamming and scrambling attacks

choices.A: Allow the transmission of all types of addressed packets at the ISP level
choices.D: Implement cognitive radios in the physical layer
choices.C: Allow the usage of functions such as gets and strcpy
